FuncDef: The upgrade all-slot command upgrades all the slots of the device.
CLIs: upgrade all-slot { <file-name> | startup } { monitorbus | firmware } [ force ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of the system software stored in the Cfcard.
The value is a string of 4 to 127 characters, spaces not supported.

Indicates using the current startup system software to upgrade the device.
-

Indicates the firmware of the slots.
-

Forces the upgrade, regardless of the version consistency.
-

Indicates the MonitorBus of the slots.
-

Examples: *                     W A R N I N G                     *
* Please ensure that the configuration has been saved.  *
* And please ensure that the board does not be powered  *
* off or be reseted during the upgrade operation.       *
* Also ensure that any board of this device is not      *
* removed (pull out or plug in) during this process.    *
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
This command is used to upgrade all the registered components such as boards or nodes. The items such as , MonitorBus, and firmware of all the entities are upgraded.
Configuration Impact
There are two modes for upgrading the items:
Upgrade the items without using the parameter force.
The system checks whether the items of all the entities match the system software. Then, the system upgrades the unmatched items, the Firmware of the master main control board is not included.
Upgrade the items using the parameter force.
The system directly upgrades all the items of entities without checking whether these items match the system software. The Firmware of the master master control is not upgraded.
During the upgrade, the master main control board resets all switch fabric units, causing all interface boards to report "TM link down" as the reset reason. This is a normal reset caused by the upgrade and can be ignored.

Precautions
When the upgrade all-slot command is run to upgrade all board firmware, such as the EPLD, the firmware of the main control board is not upgraded.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
